meanings.definition: The quality or state of being factitious.
meanings.sent1: Her constant factitiousnesses made it hard to trust her sincerity.
meanings.sent2: The factitiousnesses of the painting were revealed under close inspection.
meanings.sent3: The factitiousnesses of his excuses were so obvious that everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The factitiousnesses of the politician's promises crumbled like a house of cards.
meanings.sent5: The factitiousnesses of the artificial flowers fooled no one with their plastic appearance.

meanings.definition: The act or process of creating something artificial or fake.
meanings.sent1: The factitiousnesses of the counterfeit money were quickly detected by the authorities.
meanings.sent2: She was skilled in the factitiousnesses of creating realistic-looking sculptures.
meanings.sent3: The factitiousnesses of the magician's tricks left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The factitiousnesses of the illusionist's performance captivated the entire crowd.
meanings.sent5: The factitiousnesses of the artificial intelligence program were evident in its robotic responses.
